address: Xã Minh Lương, Huyện Văn Bàn, Tỉnh Lào Cai
thought:
**Analysis of Administrative Unit Changes for "Xã Minh Lương, Huyện Văn Bàn, Tỉnh Lào Cai"**

Okay, so I've been given the old address "Xã Minh Lương, Huyện Văn Bàn, Tỉnh Lào Cai" and need to figure out the new administrative unit(s). My initial strategy is to break this down. First, I know I need to check for any province mergers, but Lào Cai is still Lào Cai according to `60-NQ/TW`. Excellent, that simplifies things!

Now, the crucial part is identifying any changes to the ward ("Xã Minh Lương") and the district ("Huyện Văn Bàn"). I'm specifically looking through resolutions, focusing on anything relevant to Lào Cai.

I started digging into the "Other resolutions," focusing on matches for "Xã Minh Lương" within "Tỉnh Lào Cai." 1654/NQ-UBTVQH15 mentioned "Minh Lương," but it was in An Giang, not helpful. 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15 had a lot of information, I initially thought. It mentioned "xã Văn Bàn" as a *new* ward name, but that was irrelevant here; it wasn't the district. Then, Bingo! Resolution 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15, item 58, was the goldmine. It explicitly stated that "Xã Minh Lương" *was* merged! Specifically, the old "Xã Minh Lương" was merged with "Xã Nậm Xây" to form a *new* "Xã Minh Lương". The old ward name will remain the new ward name, based on the resolution.

The other resolutions were dead ends: one in Phú Thọ and the other in Nghệ An. So the solution to the "Xã Minh Lương" query is found in the merger of itself with "Xã Nậm Xây", but the resultant ward name, is the same -  "Xã Minh Lương." The district remains as "Huyện Văn Bàn" since that is not affected by the specified resolution.

citation.header: 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Lào Cai
citation.line: 58. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của xã Nậm Xây và xã Minh Lương thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Minh Lương.
